would go like this n n Republicans across Missouri have demanded we use this session to address the following issues n na Election integrity reform implementing voter ID requiring paper ballots eliminating early voting and strengthening accountability for absentee voting nb Protecting women s sports nc Protecting your right to a job without losing it for not taking a COVID vaccine nd Stopping the teaching of Critical Race Theory in our schools and increasing accountability of public schools to parents ne Repealing the gas tax increase passed by moderate Republicans last year nf Opposing the Joe Biden spending spree disaster in Washington DC ng Pass a map to reinforce Republican majorities in the US Congress n nWith session days to go NOT ONE of these priorities have passed the Missouri Senate one of the reddest states in America n n As a result a minority of Republicans informally known as the Conservative Caucus are furious They have used their power in the chamber to disrupt the passage of other non priorities to try and force the moderate Republicans to bring the real and urgent issues listed above to final passage The conservatives pursued long lasting filibusters on the redistricting process fighting for a map and forced illuminating votes on other leftist leaning bills to further expose the actions of the moderate Republicans This is the heart of the contention n n In the midst of this the Republican public has become further aware of the pattern of bad votes and actions moderate Republicans have been taking This has led to a series of primary challenges to the re election of some moderate Senators in the nupcoming election cycle further heightening the tension within the Senate Chamber n n Some moderate Republicans fearing electoral backlash have begun fundraising from some very powerful special interests in Jefferson City to raise millions to defend themselves in re election notably more than million has been set aside in a special interest Political Action Committee called Right Path PAC to defend these moderates n n In addition with six open seats up for election in the Missouri Senate that brings a total of Republican seats possibly switching from the conservative side to the moderate and vice versa Already Senators are jockeying coalitions for a leadership race that will take place once the August Republican primary concludes none of the seats in question have a competitive general election n nThis is the political and policy reality of the Republican Missouri Senate right now n nAll of the contention would leave the Republican Senate Caucus if the caucus would prioritize passing the issues voters sent us here to address This isn t about social media setting differences aside listening to others or believing the person next to you is good at heart n nThis is about fighting and winning in a war of ideas happening RIGHT NOW in America that if we lose will cost the next generation of Missourians their chance at life liberty and the pursuit of their own happiness n nI believe the ideas articulated by the Republican brand protecting our rights limiting the role of government in our lives are worth fighting for If that means kicking over some apple carts in Jefferson City count me in

The NHS is in crisis Underfunded and understaffed it is expected to clear a backlog of work arising from the Covid crisis nNHS staff have had our wages held down since the start of the banking crisis with many paid less than the Oxford living wage Though we were clapped by the government we were then slapped with another below inflation pay rise leaving us worse off nNHS workers in Oxford struggle to pay the rent and most cannot consider buying a house in one of the most expensive cities in the UK If they lived in the parts of London paying similar rents they would get an additional weighting in their pay nInstead too many are exhausting themselves working holidays and days off to make ends meet nNow we face inflation of over and huge rises on our energy bills nToo many staff leave to work in more affordable areas while millions is spent on expensive agency to fill the gaps nNHS workers deserve better NHS workers in Oxford need to be able to afford to live here to ensure a properly staffed NHS to meet people s needs nJoin NHS staff demanding the government extends London weighting to Oxford to give a pay rise supports the SOSNHS demand for an additional billion funding for the NHS this year and stops the privatisation of the NHS nJoin us in defending our NHS

violence reduction initiatives n n As of Monday morning the Lucas County Health Department has confirmed infections and deaths from COVID in Lucas County Vaccines have been distributed to of the population n n On Tuesday local officials announced that the historic and currently empty Spitzer building downtown Madison Ave had received a million grant from the Ohio Department of Development s Brownfield Remediation Program The funds will be used to remove asbestos and lead paint in the building making it more attractive to potential developers n n Also on Tuesday the Lucas County Commissioners announced that they had received recognition from the Stepping Up Initiative for their efforts to identify and address mental health among inmates of the Lucas County Jail The commissioners reported that over of inmates suffer from serious mental illnesses and up to have received services for mental health or substance abuse n n In further Tuesday news Toledo City Council voted to remove a law requiring a foot separation between convenience stores with Grim McPherson and Moline dissenting and Gadus and Melden absent n n On Wednesday local officials announced plans to develop the Glass City Enrichment Center in the former O Rourke Motor Sales building in East Toledo at a cost of million The East Toledo Family Center will oversee the space which will house a United Way Social Services Coordinator and Toledo Police Department community services officer among other community resources n n Also on Wednesday Owens Corning reported billion in net sales for the first quarter of up from the same period in Additionally net earnings were million up from Owens Corning also recently announced it would acquire Florida based decking company WearDeck n n On Thursday the Toledo Lucas County Port Authority accepted a million grant from the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency to expand Facility a disposal site for silt dredged from the Maumee River This silt was previously dumped in open waters until an Ohio law made the practice illegal in citing environmental damages n n Also on Thursday local leaders held an event urging voters to vote yes on Issue a mill year renewal levy for Mental Health and Recovery Services on the May primary election ballot Organizations represented include the Lucas County Commissioners Toledo Branch NAACP the Interdenominational Ministerial Alliance the Area Office on Aging of Northwestern Ohio and the Toledo Regional Chamber of Commerce n n On Friday Earnest Brew Works announced it would be opening a new taproom in the Westgate area at W Central Avenue by year s end n n Moody s Investor Services has upgrades Toledo Public School s bond rating from A to A an upper medium grade bond with low credit risk n n On Saturday April Tree Toledo will hold a dedication for a new tree nursery in the Old West End at the intersection of Floyd and Horton streets Those who wish to volunteer with breaking ground on the nursery should arrive at AM with work gloves tools will be provided n n Also on Saturday Engage Toledo will be hosting a drop off refuse and recycling event from AM to PM at Longfellow Elementary School W Laskey Road At no cost individuals can drop off electronic waste except for televisions CRT monitors and appliances tires on or off the rim but no commercial tires documents houseware goods clothing toys bulky items and refuse Latex paint is also accepted for per gallon n n Next Monday May the Toledo Municipal Court will open to the public again The building has previously been closed to the public due to COVID restrictions n n Next Tuesday May filming for a scene in an upcoming Tom Hanks movie A Man Called Otto will take place at the Central Union train terminal on Emerald Avenue n n Next Wednesday May at PM an informational meeting will be held at Reynolds Corner Branch Library Dorr Street about a proposed drug and alcohol treatment center at Dorr Street The facility would be a bed short term residential facility run by Unison n n Next Thursday May at PM Metroparks and Dana Inc will launch a new annual lecture series called Sustaining Our World at the new Glass City Metropark Pavilion in East Toledo The first lecture will discuss the process of converting former brownfields into usable park land using the Glass City Metropark as an example To register or for more Who is Andy Legg and why is he seeking a position on the Chambers County Public Hospital District Board I hope to answer these questions for members of our community that are not already familiar with me my family and my works within our community n nI was raised in LaPorte Texas and spent the first part of my adult life living in the Deer Park Pasadena areas In my wife Clarissa Dylan Oldest son years old at the time now and I moved to Wallisville This is the same year I became aware of the Chamber County Hospital District when I received my property tax statement in the mail Shortly after relocating we were blessed with the birth of our second Son Logan now years old and six years later our youngest daughter Cecilia aka CeCe who is now years old The decision to raise our family in the Wallisville Anahuac area is clearly one of the best Clarissa I have ever made together n nI have worked in Chambers County for over years at Covestro s Baytown site formerly Mobay Miles Bayer filling various roles in Logistics Production and most recently Maintenance Execution In my current capacity as a Contract Management Coordinator I have responsibilities for safe and efficient execution of contract maintenance on our site infrastructure This includes buildings HVAC roads ditches and utilities just to name a few I have received numerous trainings certifications while at Covestro most notably as an External Structural Fire Fighter TEEX at Texas A M University and BoardWorks Training Covestro Center for Community Engagement at Robert Morris University One of the most impactful and successful initiatives that I have been a part of was a site maintenance efficiency project where our team sought out every opportunity for money saving improvements within and outside our organization In addition to my role in maintenance at Covestro I also voluntarily serve on the sites Outreach Council Scholarship Team and also support the sites annual United Way fundraiser I was Recognized in by the United Way of Greater Baytown Area and Chambers County as Campaign Coordinator of the Year leading the sites first ever Virtual United Way Campaign during the height of the COVID pandemic n nMy volunteer work extends outside the boundaries of my Covestro family into the community where Clarissa and I raise our family I help to support the students and staff of Anahuac ISD through my participation with the Anahuac ISD Education Foundation I have been engaged with the great folks volunteering with this organization since and am privileged to have succeeded Mrs Linda Tinnerman as the foundation s President Currently on my second term as President Outside of Covestro I also support the United Way of the Greater Baytown Area and Chambers County as a member of the Community Impact Committee serving along with Kayle Smith and the United Way Grant Review Teams This year I led the Education Grant Review Team where we evaluated over in grant applications from various agencies in our surrounding communities made recommendations to our local United Way board for their approval During the COVID pandemic I also served on the United Way COVID Emergency Grant Review Team where we met on an ad hoc basis sometimes weekly to review and approve COVID related grants for agencies servicing needs within the Chamber County Area I am also a member of the Chambers County Resource Network that facilitates monthly meetings where local Non Profit organizations come together to discuss the needs within our community and look to identify resources to meet these needs n nWhat has motived me to become engaged with the Chamber County Hospital District and to seek election to one of the open at large board positions I care about people and our community Through my community engagement I have awareness of concerns for those who live in our community the tax payers and the even the folks traveling down I who are simply passing through our hospital district On a more personal note I have a child that through no action of his own has a medical condition that will likely be with him for the rest of his life Type Diabetes Additionally when I was years old this dreaded disease took someone I was very close to and I thought I d spend the rest of my life they were uninsured and in the care of a small rural hospital n nAs many of you have heard and or read there are many issues the Chamber County Hospital District is currently facing These include Timely Financial Reporting the Board needing to work harmoniously turnover in the executive management team and many more challenges that need to be overcome Together we can do this I encourage anyone to attend a monthly board meetings or to reach out to one of the board members to express your concerns I am optimistic about our future and gracious for your consideration

Savannah Small Business Spotlight The Concept Meet Van pictured and Veronica of the The Concept This minority black owned business started during the Covid pandemic After both Van and Veronica were laid off they used their skills to start The Concept Their business specializes in catering good food including my favorite Blueberry Parmesan Wings Find The Concept on Uber Eats and DoorDash Georgia let s become more committed to supporting small businesses like The Concept by starting a Georgia Small Business Association and teaching small business ownership business plans marketing etc to high school students Let s Heal Georgia Together jasonforgeorgia jasonforltgov smallbusiness theconcept savannah chathamcounty georgia drjasonhayes letshealgeorgia earlyvoting may nd primaryelection may th lieutenantgovernor
ALAMO DISRESPECTING GEORGE P BUSH MAY KILL FAMILY S POLITICAL DYNASTY n nPlease see the excellent article by Isabel Vincent that just came out in the NEW YORK POST on March describing the potential downfall of George P Bush The piece goes into quite a bit of detail about the impact that ALL OF US have had in the fight to Save the Alamo n nYou can press this link to see the original have also posted the full article below n n n nAlamo disrespecting George P Bush may kill family s political dynasty nBy Isabel Vincent nMarch am nNEW YORK POST n nAt first glance George Prescott Bush seems the ideal political candidate in a state where his family has been a powerful dynasty for decades n nThe telegenic Texas lawyer is a grandson of st US President George H W Bush and the nephew of George W Bush the rd He is the eldest son of two term Florida Gov Jeb Bush and the great grandson of US Sen Prescott Bush of Connecticut The war veteran and father of two married to blond lawyer Amanda Williams Bush is also Mexican American on his mother s side and speaks fluent Spanish n nBut that might not be enough according to critics who accuse him of being the black sheep of the family and disrespecting the Alamo Texas most treasured symbol by bringing in modern minded out of staters for its restoration n nOn Tuesday Bush and incumbent Ken Paxton beat two other Republican candidates vying to be the party s pick in the attorney general s race n nNow a critical May runoff will determine whether the fourth generation scion will be able to shore up the family s political legacy in the Lone Star State analysts say n nBut that s another problem The Bush name is not popular in Texas anymore Luke Twombly a Dallas based political consultant and former communications director of the Texas Republican Party told The Post n nPaxton the Texas attorney general since has been indicted on securities fraud charges and accused of bribery and misuse of office in a civil whistleblower lawsuit but still has the support of the state s conservatives He also has the endorsement of former President Donald Trump a situation Bush hopes to reverse by invoking Trump in his campaign ads which don t mention the titans in his own family n n Under the leadership of President Trump our country was strong and vibrant again says Bush in a campaign video At another point in the ad he notes Like President Trump I will not sit idly by while our freedoms are under attack because Texas must lead the way in fighting this radical agenda n nIf Bush is trying to capitalize on his devotion to Trump his opponents hope to end the Bush family s political dominance in Texas which began after George H W moved with his wife Barbara from Connecticut to the Lone Star State in to work in the oil business n n If conservatives unite we can end the Bush dynasty Paxton told a Lubbock radio station Wednesday The Bushes have had their chances It s time for the dynasty to end n nBush commissioner of the General Land Office in Texas has faced withering criticism from both Democrats and fellow Republicans for his work restoring the Alamo historic site He s also been under scrutiny for his agency s administration of veterans homes where the COVID fatality rate was percent at seven out of nine facilities more than double the rate at the state s other nursing homes during the height of the pandemic n nIn his eagerness to seek endorsements from Trump Bush has broken with members of his own family becoming the black sheep of a clan that has little patience for Trump s hold on the Republican Party n n I can t imagine that George P is getting a lot of love from his family in pursuit of the Trump endorsement said Twombly n nAlthough he likely needs Trump s endorsement to win the race others say Bush lacks the same leadership genes that propelled his relatives to political victory n n Well maybe he s not exactly a black sheep but Bush is not the guy Jerry Patterson Bush s predecessor on the General Land Office told The Post I knew and and Bush is not a guy who is a leader He s a decent enough fellow but if you want someone to make hard decisions he s out of it He avoids controversy puts his head down n nAs commissioner of the GLO he has played fast and loose with the Alamo the state s most sacred historic site he added Patterson was so incensed with what he called Bush s lack of transparency and bungling of the monument s restoration that he decided to run against him to get his old job back in n nWhen Patterson lost to Bush in the Republican primary for the commissioner s job he decided to back Bush s Democratic opponent Miguel Suazo in the commissioner s race He wasn t the only one n n Never in my memory have all primary opponents of a Republican candidate either endorsed the primary winner s Democratic opponent or stated publicly they wouldn t vote for the Republican primary winner Patterson said n nIn addition to Patterson losing Republican primary opponents in the race Rick Range Davey Edward and David Watts all refused to back Bush n n There are things that are more important than your party said Patterson who ran the GLO between and The Alamo is Texas n nAmong the criticisms of Bush s work on the restoration of the site which will include a new museum with a rooftop garden is a lack of transparency and the hiring of a Philadelphia design firm that suggested incorporating modern glass walls n n Calling in all these out of state so called experts who knew nothing about the Alamo nothing about what it means to Texas was Bush s first mistake according to Range a retired firefighter in an interview with the Texas Monthly n n He cannot be trusted with the future of the Alamo Range told the magazine He s flip flopped more times than a catfish stranded on the bank of a river n nDespite the criticisms Bush prominently features images of the Alamo in his campaign ads which also include several references to Trump s domestic policy greatest hits n nIn his latest ad Bush reminds viewers that he is a former Navy officer deployed to Afghanistan and promises to finish Trump s wall He is filmed in dark glasses riding an all terrain vehicle in the shadow of the wall that marks the southern border with Mexico n n It s such bulls t said Patterson Every damned politician talks about the wall but the attorney general has no impact on shutting down the border It s all bulls t It s almost what you have to do if you are a Republican in Texas n nStill Patterson like others is hesitant to write off Bush just yet n n Do I think he has a chance he said I think he has a chance n nBush s campaign and spokesman did not return The Post s calls and emails Thursday
Are you happy paying an increase of on your council tax so that Labour can squander your money on things like Cinemas and having a documentary made about Covid n nThey even spend a quarter of a million pounds of YOUR MONEY per year on car parking spaces at the mall It s not enough that you have to pay for your car parking you have to pay for theirs too

In shocking scenes at Oldham s final full Council meeting before May s election dismayed townsfolk were told to hush as if over reacting children by Chief Executive Dirty HARRY CATHERALL whilst Oldham Council leader AROOJ SHAH was forced to admit that her Council were involved in the cover up of the grooming and gang rape of our children n nAlready body searched and intimidated into revealing their identities before entering the Council chamber a group of mainly elderly members of our town were then caged as if they were the animals before they were allowed to watch this travesty to democracy play out n nThough Covid restrictions had been lifted the Borough Solicitor PAUL ENTWISTLE aided by ELIZABETH DROGAN from Constitutional Services not only prevented members of the public from asking their own questions which were instead read out on their behalf by an inept Mayor JENNY HARRISON worse they found that their questions were altered to suit n nAs the meeting reminiscent of a Belfast courtroom from the heyday of the troubles progressed And as anger was replaced by clear horror etched on the faces of those penned in behind the perspex screens brave Oldhamers witnessed a disturbing series of exchanges as an aggressive AROOJ SHAH attempted to shift blame to opposition parties and politicise the horrific abuse that her Labour Party led Council had originally claimed as bare faced lies and the allegations of far right activists n nDespite Deputy leader of Oldham Conservatives Cllr BETH SHARP s pleas to her fellow women councillors AROOJ SHAH Chadderton South HANNAH ROBERTS Royton North MARIE BASFORTH Royton South JEAN STRETTON Hollinwood ELAINE TAYLOR Chadderton Central BARBARA BROWNRIGDE Chadderton North who are all up for re election in May voted with every other Labour Party politician in the room to help keep the report suppressed n nOnly moments earlier AROOJ SHAH had been FORCED to admit what children had endured was horrific and shameful and it was abundantly clear that the victims experiences fell far short of the support victims should expect of public services the Council and GMP and for that the Council is deeply deeply sorry n nOldhamers who have long known this truth before SHAH s reluctant admission would have been concerned by what the under fire Labour Party Council leader was also forced to reveal The grooming and gang rape of children is still being committed in Oldham Yet despite this revelation AROOJ SHAH and every Labour Party councillor blocked calls for the government to be called in to help keep our town s children safe n nWith no indication from ANDY BURNHAM or his team of when the report will be published for many parents the question on their mind is no longer concern over what happened in the past to other people s children Rather fearful parents go to bed tonight deeply anxious over what may happen in the here and now to their own children n nThis last Council meeting before May s elections was a watershed moment in the history of our town In plain sight by voting down the Conservative motion passionately presented by former soldier Cllr DAVE ARNOTT Oldham Council leader AROOJ SHAH and her team of Labour Party politicians decided to gamble the safety of our town s children in a desperate last ditch attempt at trying to save their political careers n nDo Not Fear Them Do Not Fear Any Of Them n n nFor the last years I have exposed Council corruption and the cover up of the grooming and gang rape of children in Oldham If you find what I share of value please support my work by buying a coffee contributing via PayPal or subscribing to the website n n
years ago I had my son Nehemiah They took me into a recovery room and where I was holding him looking at him smiling everything a new mother does with a new baby But I noticed that every time I would ask the nurse for something they wouldn t leave the room Usually nurses will just leave to go get whatever you ask for but they wouldn t leave me by myself n nEverything I asked for she would call down and have somebody else bring it up At the time I m thinking that was weird but I still never really paid attention to it n nSo the next day his doctor came in to see him and he looked at his hands and he was evaluating him and he said I think Nehemiah has Down syndrome n nI just froze n nI said Are you sure n n Yes I think he has Down syndrome but I m not for sure he said We re going to run some tests and everything when he comes to his first doctor s appointment n nSo I call my mom on the phone hysterical I was and didn t know anything about Down syndrome I got my mom on the phone and I m crying I can barely get my words out n nBut she was already waiting for my phone call My mom was taking her social work classes at the time and they had just studied Down syndrome and she already knew n nI was crying and told her that they were going to do some test at his first doctor s appointment to find out for sure I took him to that doctor s visit and that s when they confirmed that Nehemiah had Down syndrome I took that really bad to the point where they thought they were going to have somebody come pick me up at the doctor s office and drive me home but I told them that I could drive myself n nOn the way home I stopped at a gas station just bawling my eyes out sitting there in the parking lot I called my mom on the phone and I m just like Why me I m years old I have a son that has a disability I don t know anything about and I don t know what I m going to do I asked a lot of questions Why me Why him None of my friends have a kid that has a disability None of my family members None of my siblings So why me Lord Why did you choose us n nI sat there for probably about an hour talking to my mom The thing that made me start up the car and come home was when she told me You know God gives special children to special people God gave you Nehemiah for a reason You may not know what that reason is right now and you may never find out what that reason is but God gave him to you for a reason n nAfter that I started doing some research because I felt I needed a support group to learn from or talk to people who were in the same situation The closest support group was in Mount Pleasant and that was just too far away I was having a tough time because when Nehemiah was a week old I moved back home with my mother Here I was a single mother with two kids because Nehemiah and his sister are and a half months apart n nSo I was like What can I do There s nothing here for people like us The closest support group is in Mount Pleasant and that s too far to get help n nThat s when I decided to start my first Down syndrome walk I got the flyers made and everything It was mostly just my family and friends who came out Terry Camp came out and did a news story and he actually came to a few of them I wanted more parents that had kids with disabilities to show up at this walk but I had my family and my friends there who were supportive I continued to do these walks up until COVID which now I m starting back up this year n nI never would have imagined that I would give birth to a child with Down syndrome but my son is my world and if I could go back in time I would not change anything He amazes our family everyday with the things that he says and does n nNehemiah is and will always be God s special gift to me n n Shortorah Carter

Side effects of the COVID shot are normal signs that the body is building protection and should go away in a few days They can include a sore arm tiredness headache muscle pain nausea and fever If you have questions call your healthcare provider n nUse your cellphone to report how you or family members feel after getting any dose of the COVID vaccine Enrolling in v safe can help ensure the safety of COVID vaccines for everyone nLearn more
ICYMI The Cherokee Nation held its first at large community gatherings since the beginning of the COVID pandemic April meeting with hundreds of Cherokee citizens in northern California during visits to Bakersfield Fresno and Napa April More than total Cherokee citizens participated in the three meetings along with Cherokee Nation Principal Chief Chuck Hoskin Jr Cherokee Nation First Lady January Hoskin at large members of the Council of the Cherokee Nation Julia Coates and Johnny Kidwell Jr Miss Cherokee Leah Gardner and representatives of a number of Cherokee Nation departments n nTentative dates for upcoming at large gatherings include June in Atlanta Georgia July in Albuquerque New Mexico and July in Denver Colorado More information on those events and others will be announced soon so stay tuned to our official Facebook page

Council Rik would focus on the following n n Prioritising the climate and biodiversity emergency in all council decision making n Leading on bringing council funded firework displays into the st century with an end to harmful noise greater use of new visual technologies n Ensuring the council delivers on its promise of a dog friendly section of beach n Campaigning for wildlife tunnels and or native hedging for boundaries in all new planning applications n Fighting for cleaner air especially around schools and playgrounds by discouraging idling and planting more trees at boundaries n Working to ensure Southend s roads are safe for all pedestrians cyclists and motorists n Championing the borough s ability to become a nationwide leader in the battle against single use plastic n nRik shares his home with dog Loki and cat Dusk in Southend s Victoria ward where he has lived for years Rik works as a Team Leader for Greene King at The Guildford public house and is a passionate animal advocate Rik has spent years studying and practicing as a Canine Behaviourist and Hydro Therapist before the impact of covid meant him returning to the hospitality trade Rik is an active volunteer at the local RSPCA branch helping animals in need in the immediate area n nRik believes that now is the time to create a more ethical environment for animals and to protect their status in law Rik became a member of AWP in the run up to the last general election after discovering the party when researching who he should vote for After reading numerous party manifestos Rik concluded that AWP is the party that best represents him On a national level Rik wants an end to Breed Specific Legislation BSL and for animal sentience to be recognised n nRik has put himself forward to stand in this election for AWP because he wants to raise the profile not only of AWP but of the suffering of animals Rik believes there s huge potential for Southend to become a fairer more compassionate and sustainable home for people animals and environment n nRik says AWP is the only party that has the commitment of working within the political system to drive the positive shift needed in reducing animal suffering while at the same time improving public health and our impact on the environment I urge Victoria ward residents to vote for a fairer future for all this May th n nIf Rik s message resonates with you please VoteAWP this Thursday Polling stations will be open am to pm n n LocalElections Southend Victoria

JUST RELEASED Our third TV ad of our campaign to be New York s next Governor entitled Parents Rights The best thing for kids is for their parents to be as involved as possible in their education The best thing for the upbringing of a child is for the family unit to be as strong as possible I m running for Governor to put parents and students first I m highly suspicious of those in government discouraging parental involvement Parents have a fundamental right to control the upbringing of their child and they do not relinquish that right because they send their kids off to school That includes curriculum transparency textbook transparency deciding whether their kids will be masked and given the COVID shot advocating for age appropriate and content appropriate material school choice and far more
Illegal immigrants making their way onto American soil is not a new phenomenon but the number of crossings where they are going and the lawlessness resulting from Joe Biden s lack of border security is n nBy dismantling President Trump s robust and protective border policy the Biden administration has opened the whole of America to increased threats on multiple fronts and put American families in the path of killer drugs and human trafficking n nAnd his administration isn t finished yet n nJust last month he pressed to end Title a Trump era policy that allowed Border Patrol agents to immediately deport million illegal aliens with communicable diseases including COVID over the last few years Removing the last remaining piece of Trump s border policy would have further cleared the path for unfiltered and unvetted immigrants who are pouring into America like never before n nIn March alone migrants raided our border marking the worst month in Department of Homeland Security history And no one can quantify how many of those migrants carried with them illicit drugs or a criminal history n nDuring for example individuals on the terror watch list were captured on the border and those were only the ones we caught n nThese illegal immigrants aren t staying in what we consider the border states either They re spreading throughout the country traveling on the dime of the U S taxpayer and Mississippi is one of the listed destinations n nLast July over the course of just three days more than illegal immigrants were transported to the Natchez bus station and released by ICE under the direction of President Biden This nightmare scenario is turning every state into a border state and the crisis is only getting worse n nLast month pounds of fentanyl and pounds of methamphetamine was seized on the southern border Much more made it through undetected These drugs are killing American citizens Between October and October more than Americans overdosed a record high Two thirds of these deaths were due to fentanyl alone n nMississippi is not immune n nAccording to the Mississippi Department of Health deaths involving fentanyl climbed from in to in Overall drug overdoses exceeded n nThe Biden administration has shown they are uninterested in protecting our families from the dangers of an open border upholding law or preserving order So it is imperative we take that role on ourselves with a zero tolerance approach at the local level n nFor me and sheriffs across the country the bottom line really is the safety of the American people and the trust they place in those they vote into office We must send a message to Washington that our communities will not become sanctuaries for illicit activity and to achieve those ends we must work hand in hand with ICE Border Patrol and local agencies to find report and remove illegal immigrants n nA Trump appointed federal judge in Louisiana has temporarily blocked President Biden s Title elimination plan but the issue is far from settled Title is important but it alone has not and will not properly protect our families from the invasion on our southern border It is going to take resuming the construction of the wall and reinstating Trump s immigration policies n nUntil that happens and the federal government assumes its proper role the responsibility will continue to fall on the shoulders of local law We are happy to announce State Senator Emanuel Jones has endorsed Judge Jones for reelection as Chief Magistrate Senator Jones and Senator Brian Strickland sponsored the Local Act for the Magistrate Court technology fund The passage of the Local Act by the General Assembly was instrumental in keeping the Magistrate Court functioning during the COVID pandemic Over was collected and used to purchase and install video conferencing equipment cell phone boosters and Wi Fi boosters to allow virtual hearings from the jail courtroom Thank you Senator Jones for your foresight and support

On th May voters across Cardiff go to the polls in one of the most critical elections of our lifetime n nIn Rhiwbina we re running on our values and to make our local area and city stronger fairer and greener for everyone Whether you re a traditional Labour voter or have supported other parties in past elections we ask for your support and vote on th May n nPeople are tired of the same old politics from Conservative Government in Westminster and on th May we get to unite as a city to send a clear message of our values in Rhiwbina n n Labour in Wales stood up against the Conservatives when they took a week from the most vulnerable in society and demanded more to be done to help people with the cost of living crisis n n Labour in Wales has invested more than million in a support package for low income households to meet the immediate pressures on living costs n n Labour in Wales took the pandemic seriously to protect people and stood up to demand greater transparency and accountability when rules were broken and taxpayers money wasted n n Labour in Cardiff has invested millions in transforming education for our young people creating community hubs across the city prioritising the care of the vulnerable producing good quality affordable housing for everyone and progressing our vision to be a Carbon Neutral City by n n Labour has stood up against MPs having second jobs by campaigning and calling on the Conservative government to ban the practice n n In contrast to the Conservatives in England Labour rolled out Free School Meals across all Welsh primary schools including in the summer holidays during the Covid crisis n nWith your support on th May we will create a stronger fairer and greener Rhiwbina for everyone
